DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to train patients with Parkinson's Disease to increase activity in a brain area that is involved in the control of motor functions with the use of a technique called real-time fMRI neurofeedback (NF) along with regular physical exercise. This will be a randomised and controlled clinical trial to evaluate the benefits of a novel treatment. The investigators expect NF training along with physical exercise practise to better improve motor functions compared to physical exercise alone.
DOC.brief_title: Real-time fMRI Neurofeedback for Treatment of Parkinson's Disease
DOC.criteria: People with Parkinson's Disease Hoehn and Yahr stages 13 of the disease Patients with dementia or significant comorbidity those who fail the safety screening to go into an MRI scanner those who cannot travel to the University
